description: From Middle French médication, from Latin medicatio, from medicari (“to heal, cure”), from medicus (“a physician, surgeon”), from mederi (“to heal”).

entries.meaning: A medicine, or all the medicines regularly taken by a patient.
examples: Have you been taking your medication? [uncountable]
Have you been taking your medications? [countable]
Such behavior, if it doesn't abate, will necessitate medication and supervision.
